title: Rudd warns against new cold war
text:
Kevin Rudd has joined nine other former world leaders to call on China and the United States to end their trade war by year's end or risk greater damage to global growth and the eventual onset of a new cold war that will threaten peace.

Mr Rudd has lent his name to an article published in The New York Times which says the 18-month trade war "represents the single greatest threat to global economic growth today".

Trade war warning: Former Prime Minister Kevin Rudd. Alex Ellinghausen

It also echoes concerns that unless resolved, the ongoing stand-off will lead to an eventual decoupling of the Chinese and US economies, particularly in technology and finance.

"Beyond trade, we are anxious about the wider strategic impact of any further decoupling of the Chinese and the American economies, particularly in technology and finance," the article says.

"Such a decoupling would present a long-term threat to global peace and security.
description: Kevin Rudd and nine other former world leaders have called on China and the US to end their trade war by Christmas for the good of the globe.
